Definition 5.2.1 (Inner product): for (modeled as continuous, : Type-periodic functions : Type ), define .

noncomputable def periodicInnerProduct (f g : {h : // Continuous h Function.Periodic h 1}) : := x in Set.Icc (0 : ) 1, f.1 x * star (g.1 x)

def periodicOrthogonal (f g : {h : // Continuous h Function.Periodic h 1}) : Prop := periodicInnerProduct f g = 0

The sum of two continuous, 1 : 1-periodic complex-valued functions is continuous and 1 : 1-periodic.

lemma continuous_periodic_add (f g : {h : // Continuous h Function.Periodic h 1}) : Continuous (f.1 + g.1) Function.Periodic (f.1 + g.1) 1 := by constructor exact f.2.1.add g.2.1 simpa using f.2.2.add g.2.2

A scalar multiple of a continuous, 1 : 1-periodic complex-valued function is continuous and 1 : 1-periodic.

lemma continuous_periodic_smul (c : ) (f : {h : // Continuous h Function.Periodic h 1}) : Continuous (c f.1) Function.Periodic (c f.1) 1 := by constructor simpa [Pi.smul_apply] using (continuous_const.mul f.2.1) simpa [Pi.smul_apply] using f.2.2.smul c

The pointwise sum in modeled as continuous, 1 : 1-periodic functions : Type .

noncomputable def addPeriodicFunction (f g : {h : // Continuous h Function.Periodic h 1}) : {h : // Continuous h Function.Periodic h 1} := f.1 + g.1, continuous_periodic_add f g

Scalar multiplication in modeled as continuous, 1 : 1-periodic functions : Type .

noncomputable def smulPeriodicFunction (c : ) (f : {h : // Continuous h Function.Periodic h 1}) : {h : // Continuous h Function.Periodic h 1} := c f.1, continuous_periodic_smul c f
